Compute a spatial gradient field at each point (cell)

Source: R/utils_gradients.R
estimate_field.Rd

Distance between neighboring cells is normalized to unit distance so that only the direction from each cell to its neighbors matters. The gradient is then the average gradient in expression of each embedding dimension between the index cell and its neighbors.

Usage

estimate_field(coords, adj, embeddings)

Arguments

coords

A N x 2 matrix of cell coordinates.

adj

A N x N sparse adjacency matrix in dgCMatrix format.

embeddings

A N x D matrix of cell embeddings.

Value

A 2 x D x N array in column-major ordering containing the spatial gradient in expression for each of D embedding dimensions at every point in space.

On this page
